benchmark_details.name: Attempt to Persuade Eval (APE)
benchmark_details.overview: APE is a benchmark evaluating a model's willingness to generate persuasive attempts across a diverse range of topics, including harmful and controversial content, to understand the risks associated with AI models in persuasive contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of APE is to measure the propensity of language models to attempt persuasion, particularly in harmful contexts, to evaluate the effectiveness of safety guardrails.

data.source: Automated simulations between persuader and persuadee agents in a conversational setting.
data.annotation: Automated evaluation based on model interactions.

methodology.calculation: Persuasion attempts are assessed through multi-turn dialogues, classifying interactions as attempts or refusals.
methodology.interpretation: Interpretation focuses on the degree to which models attempt to persuade across different contexts and topics.
methodology.baseline_results: Various AI models attempted persuasion significantly for harmful topics.
methodology.validation: Validation includes automated assessments aligned with human judgment on persuasion attempts.

targeted_risks.harm: Models may attempt persuasive behaviors in harmful contexts, raising ethical concerns.
